content:
• Tuesday, February 19, 2013
  • UCTT

    More on Ultra Clean (NASDAQ:UCTT): Q4 beats the Street on a 3.7% rise in total sales over the...

    More on Ultra Clean (NASDAQ:UCTT): Q4 beats the Street on a 3.7% rise in total sales over the year-ago period. Gross margin rose 12.8% from 11.0%. For Q1, the company give a mixed forecast. It now expects to earn revenue in the range of $96M - $101M, above the current $95.44 Street view, and EPS in the range of a loss of $0.02 to a gain of $0.02, below the current Street view for a gain of $0.04. Shares +5.4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:58 PM
  • LOPE

    More on Grand Canyon Education (NASDAQ:LOPE): Q4 beats on EPS and revenue as total sales jump...

    More on Grand Canyon Education (NASDAQ:LOPE): Q4 beats on EPS and revenue as total sales jump 25% Y/Y. Total enrollment increased by 19% during the prior year, while ground enrollment increased 52.1% over the same period. Shares +5.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:38 PM
  • CPRI

    Sellers in the 25M share secondary of Michael Kors (KORS) include some of its biggest holders,...

    Sellers in the 25M share secondary of Michael Kors (KORS) include some of its biggest holders, who are apparently looking to cash in from the stock's recent runup. Its biggest seller is Hong Kong private-equity firm Sportswear Holdings, who is selling around 20M shares and reducing its current 15.6% ownership stake to 5.8%. Michael Kors, the company's namesake and chief creative officer, will offer 3M shares, thus lowering his current 3.9% stake to 2.4%. Shares -2.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:15 PM
  • LZB

    More on La-Z-Boy (NYSE:LZB): Q4 beats across the board on a 10.3% increase in total sales versus...

    More on La-Z-Boy (NYSE:LZB): Q4 beats across the board on a 10.3% increase in total sales versus the prior year period. Net income rose 14% as its retail segment swung back to profitability. Sales in the unit, which includes La-Z-Boy Furniture Galleries stores, swung to an operating profit of $2.67M from a year-earlier loss of $646K. Same-store written sales, which the company tracks as an indicator of retail activity, rose 12%. Wholesale upholstery, a main contributor to its top line, saw revenue rise by 12% to $279.9M. Shares +10.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:44 PM
  • ONCY

    Oncolytics Biotech (NASDAQ:ONCY) initiates a public stock offering for an undetermined amount of...

    Oncolytics Biotech (NASDAQ:ONCY) initiates a public stock offering for an undetermined amount of shares. The company says the size and price of the offering are to be determined at the time of pricing. It intends to use the net proceeds to fund its clinical trial program, manufacturing program and for general corporate and working capital purposes. Shares -7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:27 PM
  • MDRX

    More on Allscripts (NASDAQ:MDRX): Q4 misses on all counts as results were hit by weaker sales, a...

    More on Allscripts (NASDAQ:MDRX): Q4 misses on all counts as results were hit by weaker sales, a deferred-revenue provision plus other items. Total revenue declined 9.6% Y/Y and gross margin fell to 38.8% from 45.1%. One bright spot however, was bookings - a key leading indicator for health IT firms - which came in at $180.7M, well ahead of consensus expectations. That is driving the stock higher in the post-trading session, with shares currently +6.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:20 PM
  • ICAD

    iCAD (NASDAQ:ICAD): Q4 EPS of -$0.15. Revenue of $7.8M (+18% Y/Y). Shares -1.4% AH. (PR)

    iCAD (NASDAQ:ICAD): Q4 EPS of -$0.15. Revenue of $7.8M (+18% Y/Y). Shares -1.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:16 PM
  • TEX

    Terex Corporation (NYSE:TEX): Q4 EPS of -$0.28 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.40....

    Terex Corporation (NYSE:TEX): Q4 EPS of -$0.28 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.40. Revenue of $1.70B misses by $130M. Shares -2.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:15 PM
  • SINA

    Sina (NASDAQ:SINA) now +6.6% following its Q4 beat. Along with its report, the company ...

    Sina (NASDAQ:SINA) now +6.6% following its Q4 beat. Along with its report, the company  announces COO Hong Du is now a co-president, and former Cisco/eBay exec Jack Xu has been named CTO. Online ad sales +7% Y/Y to $110.7M (80% of revenue). Mobile value-added services (VAS) continue plunging, -38% to $13.2M. But Weibo VAS (closely-watched) +181% to $10.6M. Opex +11% Y/Y, higher than revenue growth. Gross margin was 57%, up from 54% in Q3 and a year ago. CC at 8PM ET (webcast). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:54 PM
  • CRTX

    Cornerstone Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CRTX) +20% AH to $6.55 after disclosing Italy's Chiesi...

    Cornerstone Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CRTX) +20% AH to $6.55 after disclosing Italy's Chiesi Therapeutics, which already owns 65% of Cornerstone, delivered a letter yesterday offering to buy the rest of it for $6.40-$6.70/share in cash. (13D)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM
  • RMBS

    Rambus (NASDAQ:RMBS) +3.8% AH after: 1) Announcing a settlement and patent licensing deal with...

    Rambus (NASDAQ:RMBS) +3.8% AH after: 1) Announcing a settlement and patent licensing deal with LSI-OLD, one of the chipmakers it had filed an ITC complaint against. The licensing deal lasts through 2018. 2) Raising its Q1 revenue guidance range to $65M-$69M from a prior $58M-$63M, thanks to a one-time payment related to the LSI deal. The consensus is at $61M. Shares rose 6.4% in regular trading.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:29 PM
  • NBR

    More on Nabors' (NYSE:NBR) Q4 results: Adjusted operating earnings for the U.S. lower 48...

    More on Nabors' (NYSE:NBR) Q4 results: Adjusted operating earnings for the U.S. lower 48 land-drilling business, NBR's largest segment, fell 27% Y/Y, while its completion and production services segment dropped 50% amid weakness in the domestic pressure-pumping business. Expects a marked decline in Q1 income given low rig counts and depressed spot market rates. Shares -2.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:16 PM
  • P

    Pandora (NYSE:P) -2.7% AH and Velti (VELT) -3.4% in response to mobile display ad network owner...

    Pandora (NYSE:P) -2.7% AH and Velti (VELT) -3.4% in response to mobile display ad network owner Millennial Media's Q4 revenue miss and light top-line guidance. Pandora received 62% of its FQ3 revenue from mobile, but its mobile ad rates are still well below its PC ad rates; the company's FQ4 report should arrive in early March. Velti's Q4 report is also expected in the coming weeks.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:12 PM | 1 Comment
  • GDOT

    Green Dot (NYSE:GDOT) +19.6% AH on on news TSS is acquiring Green Dot rival NetSpend at a 30%...

    Green Dot (NYSE:GDOT) +19.6% AH on on news TSS is acquiring Green Dot rival NetSpend at a 30% premium. The prepaid card vendor has been the subject of M&A speculation in the past. 9% of the float was shorted as of Jan. 31.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:04 PM
  • LEAF

    More on Demand Media: Company says it's exploring the breakup of its media and domain name ops...

    More on Demand Media: Company says it's exploring the breakup of its media and domain name ops into separate, publicly-traded companies. Media sales +25% Y/Y (exc. TAC) in Q4 to $62.3M, domain name sales +10% to $34.5M. Page views +24% Y/Y on owned sites, -8% for network sites. Network ad prices +37% Y/Y. Demand expects Q1 revenue of $100M-$102M and EPS of $0.07-$0.08 vs. consensus of $95.9M and $0.10. Expects 2013 revenue of $435M-$443M and EPS of $0.39-$0.43 vs. consensus of $413.8M and $0.46. DMD +15.4% AH. CC at 5PM ET (webcast). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM
  • UCTT

    Ultra Clean Holdings (NASDAQ:UCTT): Q4 EPS of $0.00 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $90.1M (-10.7%...

    Ultra Clean Holdings (NASDAQ:UCTT): Q4 EPS of $0.00 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $90.1M (-10.7% Y/Y) beats by $0.87M. Shares +4.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM
  • FNGN

    Financial Engines (NASDAQ:FNGN): Q4 EPS of $0.16 in-line. Revenue of $51.4M (+26% Y/Y) misses by...

    Financial Engines (NASDAQ:FNGN): Q4 EPS of $0.16 in-line. Revenue of $51.4M (+26% Y/Y) misses by $0.5M. Shares -11% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM
  • HLF

    Herbalife (NYSE:HLF): Q4 EPS of $1.05 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $1.06B beats by $122M. (PR)....

    Herbalife (NYSE:HLF): Q4 EPS of $1.05 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $1.06B beats by $122M. (PR). Shares +2.2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM | 2 Comments
  • CPRI

    Not wasting any time following the shelf filing, Michael Kors (KORS) announces a 25M share...

    Not wasting any time following the shelf filing, Michael Kors (KORS) announces a 25M share secondary offering, with underwriters granted a 30-day option for another 3.75M shares. Shares -2.5% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM
  • LEAF

    Demand Media (DMD): Q4 EPS of $0.12 beats by $0.01. Total Revenue of $84.4M (+22% Y/Y) misses by...

    Demand Media (DMD): Q4 EPS of $0.12 beats by $0.01. Total Revenue of $84.4M (+22% Y/Y) misses by $12.3M. Shares +17% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM
  • SHO

    Sunstone Hotel (NYSE:SHO): Q4 FFO of $0.30 in-line. Revenue of $233M misses by $9.64M. Shares...

    Sunstone Hotel (NYSE:SHO): Q4 FFO of $0.30 in-line. Revenue of $233M misses by $9.64M. Shares -1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM
  • KONA

    Kona Grill (NASDAQ:KONA): Q4 EPS of $0.10 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $23M misses by $0.07M....

    Kona Grill (NASDAQ:KONA): Q4 EPS of $0.10 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $23M misses by $0.07M. Shares -1.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • LZB

    La-Z-Boy (NYSE:LZB): FQ3 EPS of $0.28 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $349.1M (+10.3% Y/Y) beats by...

    La-Z-Boy (NYSE:LZB): FQ3 EPS of $0.28 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $349.1M (+10.3% Y/Y) beats by $11.3M. Shares +10% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • GPI

    Group 1 Automotive (GPI -7.5%) finishes the day down hard after the company missed Q4 estimates...

    Group 1 Automotive (GPI -7.5%) finishes the day down hard after the company missed Q4 estimates this morning. Despite the miss, total gross profit grew 14% on 19.3% higher revenues, while new vehicle revenues increased 22.3% on 20.8% more unit sales. Read more on earnings here: Earnings Call Transcript.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • LOPE

    Grand Canyon Education (NASDAQ:LOPE): Q4 EPS of $0.46 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $141.3M (+25%...

    Grand Canyon Education (NASDAQ:LOPE): Q4 EPS of $0.46 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $141.3M (+25% Y/Y) beats by $5.21M. Shares +2.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • CLNY

    Northstar Realty Finance (NRF) announces a 30M share secondary. Together with the 4.5M...

    Northstar Realty Finance (NRF) announces a 30M share secondary. Together with the 4.5M underwriter option, the sale would increase the float by about 20%. Shares -1.2% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM
  • TXRH

    Texas Roadhouse (NASDAQ:TXRH): Q4 EPS of $0.19 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $309.5M (+12% Y/Y)...

    Texas Roadhouse (NASDAQ:TXRH): Q4 EPS of $0.19 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $309.5M (+12% Y/Y) beats by $0.43M. Shares -2.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM
  • TSS

    TSYS (NYSE:TSS) to acquire NetSpend (NASDAQ:NTSP), a leading provider of general purpose...

    TSYS (NYSE:TSS) to acquire NetSpend (NASDAQ:NTSP), a leading provider of general purpose reloadable (GPR) prepaid debit cards, for $16.00/share cash, or $1.4B, a 30% premium. Good call by Bret Jensen back in May 2012. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM | 2 Comments
  • CPRI

    Michael Kors (KORS) files a shelf offering for the sale of ordinary shares "from time to time."...

    Michael Kors (KORS) files a shelf offering for the sale of ordinary shares "from time to time." The stock is active, but currently flat in AH trade.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • MM

    Millennial Media (NYSE:MM): Q4 GAAP EPS of $0.03. Revenue of $58M misses by $4.89M. Shares -24%...

    Millennial Media (NYSE:MM): Q4 GAAP EPS of $0.03. Revenue of $58M misses by $4.89M. Shares -24% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM | 1 Comment
  • AMRS

    Amyris (NASDAQ:AMRS): Q4 EPS of -$0.49 misses by $0.08. Revenue of $5.9M misses by $4.78M....

    Amyris (NASDAQ:AMRS): Q4 EPS of -$0.49 misses by $0.08. Revenue of $5.9M misses by $4.78M. Shares +1.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • MRO

    Marathon Oil (MRO +2.9%) shares hit a 52-week high after Oppenheimer raises its target price to...

    Marathon Oil (MRO +2.9%) shares hit a 52-week high after Oppenheimer raises its target price to $45 from $40 to reflect an improved outlook and attractive valuation. With an estimated free cash flow of $900M this year and $1.5B next year, the firm notes MRO is among a very few cash-flow-positive E&P companies; also, Eagle Ford volume should double this year, boosting MRO's production growth to 6%-8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM
  • UNXL

    UniPixel (UNXL +6.5%) is closing with a decent gain. This morning, the company announced it had...

    UniPixel (UNXL +6.5%) is closing with a decent gain. This morning, the company announced it had hired circuit board industry vet Robert Berg to be its new sales chief. 41.7% of the float was shorted as of Jan. 31, making a squeeze easy to come by. Longs and shorts continue to duel on SA ahead of the touchscreen film maker's Feb. 26 Q4 report.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM
  • EHTH

    eHealth (EHTH -17.8%) gives back virtually all of last years gains as the stock craters for a...

    eHealth (EHTH -17.8%) gives back virtually all of last years gains as the stock craters for a second straight day following a disappointing Q4 report. William Blair says the company's Medicare business hasn't kept pace with expectations, and 2013 looks like "more of an investment year." However, it believes the selloff is overdone.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM | 1 Comment
  • DAKT

    Daktronics (DAKT -11%) gets smacked today after its FQ3 missed estimates. Net profit actually...

    Daktronics (DAKT -11%) gets smacked today after its FQ3 missed estimates. Net profit actually rose 63% Y/Y, boosted by a tax benefit and lower expenses, but revenue from several major segments dropped. The stock's down today, but it's worth noting that orders were up across-the-board, including 62% overseas. Read more on earnings here: Earnings Call Transcript.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM
  • WLT

    Walter Energy (WLT +4.3%) shares surge as Audley Capital Advisors says it will nominate five...

    Walter Energy (WLT +4.3%) shares surge as Audley Capital Advisors says it will nominate five candidates for the board of the coal producer at the upcoming shareholders meeting. Audley says WLT "has consistently failed to deliver shareholder value as a result of questionable financial decisions and poor management."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM | 1 Comment
  • EA

    Electronic Arts (EA +3.4%) and Take-Two (TTWO +3.1%) have rallied today; EA is within a hair's...

    Electronic Arts (EA +3.4%) and Take-Two (TTWO +3.1%) have rallied today; EA is within a hair's breadth of its 52-week high, and Take-Two is only 4% away from its own. The latest reports (I, II) about Sony's upcoming PlayStation 4 (expected to be announced tomorrow) could be stoking investor optimism. Both game developers rallied (I, II) following their calendar Q4 reports.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM
  • TOT

    Total (TOT +3%) says it should be exempt from an Indonesian central bank restriction on sending...

    Total (TOT +3%) says it should be exempt from an Indonesian central bank restriction on sending earnings back to the company's home country, believing companies operating under production-sharing contracts with the Indonesian government shouldn't be treated the same as other exporters. TOT doesn't say what steps it is considering over the regulation.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM | 1 Comment
  • SINA

    Sina (SINA -3.5%) is slumping ahead of this afternoon's Q4 report, thanks in part to a selloff...

    Sina (SINA -3.5%) is slumping ahead of this afternoon's Q4 report, thanks in part to a selloff in Shanghai.  Weibo monetization will once more be in focus, as will the company's suddenly aggressive mobile push. Shares cratered in November thanks to the guidance provided with Sina's Q3 report, but subsequently rebounded.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM
  • TSLA

    Tesla Motors (TSLA +5.5%) moves higher as the bite is taken out of last week's critical article...

    Tesla Motors (TSLA +5.5%) moves higher as the bite is taken out of last week's critical article on the automaker by a NYT reporter. What to watch: Push comes to shove on production numbers tomorrow as the automaker reports earnings with speculation raging. A report tipping off the waiting period for Model S delivery is down to 30 days is a development which could either be a gigantic positive showing the automaker's production has ramped up significantly or a disturbing trend if people have been asking for their deposits back.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM | 16 Comments
  • AWI

    Armstrong World Industries (AWI -3.8%) slips today after its Q4 beat estimates across the board,...

    Armstrong World Industries (AWI -3.8%) slips today after its Q4 beat estimates across the board, but the company issued a mixed FY13 forecast. Net earnings edged down 1.2% as the flooring and building products maker's revenue slipped and tax expenses rose, though margins improved to 22.1% from 20.2%. For 2013, the company expecte to earn $2.30 to $2.60 a share on revenue of $2.7B to $2.8B. Analysts projected $2.89 on $2.72B in revenue, respectively.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 PM
  • RRC

    Critics of Range Resources (RRC +3%) say the company, which pioneered the use of fracking in...

    Critics of Range Resources (RRC +3%) say the company, which pioneered the use of fracking in Pennsylvania’s Marcellus shale, uses bullying tactics in dealing with residents, local officials and activists. "Most companies avoid the perception of the big bad bully oil company, while Range embraces it," but such an approach could backfire, as RRC is reliant on regulatory approvals which require some level of local support.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM | 1 Comment
  • LPDX

    LipoScience (LPDX +0.6%) moves up after Piper Jaffray initiates the shares with an Overweight...

    LipoScience (LPDX +0.6%) moves up after Piper Jaffray initiates the shares with an Overweight and a $15.00 price target. Piper notes that ongoing traction converting its LDL-C patient monitoring assays to LDL-P and represents a potential $330M annual revenue run-rate, which would exceed both its top and bottom-line projections. Separately, Barclay's and UBS also initiated coverage with an Overweight and Buy, respectively.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM
  • VECO

    LED equipment makers Veeco (VECO -1.8%) and Aixtron (AIXG -5.2%) slump after JPMorgan's Paul...

    LED equipment makers Veeco (VECO -1.8%) and Aixtron (AIXG -5.2%) slump after JPMorgan's Paul Coster lowers Veeco to Neutral. Coster, who's lowering his 2013 EPS forecast, is worried about weak near-term sales for MOCVD reactors from LED makers thanks to overcapacity - Veeco raised the issue on Feb. 8. LED chip/lighting giant Cree (CREE -0.3%) has been downgraded to Perform by Oppenheimer on valuation grounds - shares now trade at 27x FY14E EPS - but is only off slightly.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:36 PM
  • XLNX

    Xilinx (XLNX +2.5%) makes new 52-week highs following an upgrade to Buy from BofA/Merrill. The...

    Xilinx (XLNX +2.5%) makes new 52-week highs following an upgrade to Buy from BofA/Merrill. The firm sees a 2H pickup in telecom capex boosting demand for Xilinx's FPGAs from telecom equipment clients, and also thinks the chipmaker's March 5 analyst day could serve as a catalyst. Xilinx's Communications & Data Center sales rose just 2% Y/Y in Q4, and made up 47% of revenue.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM
  • HLF

    Perhaps it's just opportunistic, but hedge fund Kingdon Capital capitalizes on January's...

    Perhaps it's just opportunistic, but hedge fund Kingdon Capital capitalizes on January's weakness in Herbalife (HLF +1.7%) to take a new, albeit small - with the emphasis on small here - position in the embattled stock. Other players, however, have already pulled some money out of the game after the stock rebounded strong throughout last month. Dan Loeb's Third Point, who took a position soon following Bill Ackman's short announcement, has sold off some of his position, while Chapman Capital has closed out its long position entirely.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM | 1 Comment
  • KZIA

    Midday top 10 gainers: NVGN +134%. PVFC +53%. CMGE +42%. OTCPK:TELOZ +41%. EMITF +37%. ZIPR...

    Midday top 10 gainers: NVGN +134%. PVFC +53%. CMGE +42%. OTCPK:TELOZ +41%. EMITF +37%. ZIPR +24%. RRGB +20%. OMX +20%. GSB +18%. LOAN +18%.
    Midday top 10 losers: OTC:MYRX -95%. CPSL -35%. GMXR -29%. DGIT -25%. SNFCA -20%. EHTH -17%. CIMT -16%. RVLT -13%. MARK -13%. PERY -12%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM
  • FCX

    Copper investors are spooked after China authorities took steps to ease inflationary pressures,...

    Copper investors are spooked after China authorities took steps to ease inflationary pressures, tightening liquidity by reversing policy on repos and draining $4.8B from the system. The move has affected shares of Freeport McMoRan (FCX -2.3%) and Southern Copper (SCCO -2.3%); China equities (FXI -2.1%) also are under pressure.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM | 5 Comments
  • CVS

    CVS Caremark (CVS +2.6%) and Rite Aid (RAD +5.4%) both trade higher, riding the back of a strong...

    CVS Caremark (CVS +2.6%) and Rite Aid (RAD +5.4%) both trade higher, riding the back of a strong quarter and promising guidance from Express Scripts. Sector peer Walgreen (WAG +0.9%) isn't quite keeping up despite a price target boost by Cantor Fitzgerald to $45.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM | 2 Comments
  • OCZ

    Sell on the news? OCZ Technology (OCZ -7.7%) is off sharply after announcing the NASDAQ has...

    Sell on the news? OCZ Technology (OCZ -7.7%) is off sharply after announcing the NASDAQ has accepted its plan to regain listing compliance - the plan requires OCZ to file its much-delayed August and November quarter 10-Qs by April 8. Separately, OCZ is announcing a new Vertex SSD that relies on flash memory produced using a 20nm manufacturing process (allows for higher densities, and perhaps also lower costs).

     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM
  • PCYC

    Pharmacyclics (PCYC -4.4%) slips after being downgraded to Market Perform at Leerink Swann on...

    Pharmacyclics (PCYC -4.4%) slips after being downgraded to Market Perform at Leerink Swann on the back of its recent run. Leerink says that a number of key catalysts have already been realized, and further upside beyond its current valuation while possible, will require stronger sales numbers from ibrutinib than what's currently available. The firm raised its price target on the stock to $97 from $80.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM
  • GEOS

    Geospace Technologies (GEOS +4.7%) jumps following a favorable write-up from SA Pro author Mike...

    Geospace Technologies (GEOS +4.7%) jumps following a favorable write-up from SA Pro author Mike Williams. Demand for Geospace's GSX wireless seismic data acquisition systems (more reliable/convenient than traditional wired systems) is growing rapidly, Williams points out, and a major Y/Y drop in opex as a % of sales in FQ1 demonstrates significant operating leverage. Geospace has been on a tear in recent months.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM
  • BB

    BlackBerry (BBRY +3%) is rebounding a bit from last week's bludgeoning in spite of a critical...

    BlackBerry (BBRY +3%) is rebounding a bit from last week's bludgeoning in spite of a critical note from Canaccord's Mike Walkley. Walkley, who's reiterating a Sell, joins Deutsche in arguing early Z10 sellout were due to limited supplies, and claims follow-up checks indicate "steady but modest sales levels." He's now forecasting just 300K BB10 sales for the Feb. quarter (ed: that seems low even if sales are light, considering channel inventory), down from a prior 1.4M.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM | 31 Comments
  • EGO

    A violent attack in Greece, where ~50 people broke into Eldorado Gold’s (EGO -2.4%)...

    A violent attack in Greece, where ~50 people broke into Eldorado Gold’s (EGO -2.4%) Skouries project and attacked personnel and set fire to offices, highlights the risks for the company as it counts on the country to deliver much of its future production growth. On the other hand, Skouries is fully permitted and enjoys support of local and federal governments desperate for investment.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM | 2 Comments
  • SD

    In its latest charge against SandRidge Energy (SD +1.8%), hedge fund TPG-Axon alleges that a...

    In its latest charge against SandRidge Energy (SD +1.8%), hedge fund TPG-Axon alleges that a company controlled by the CEO's children has amassed ~475K acres near SD's operations and would benefit from SD's efforts to build infrastructure there.
